00040 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00041 // Classes and helper functions for the extension mechanism
00042 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00043 // Helper function:
00044 inline unsigned int max_num_extensions(bool increment=false)
00045 {
00046     static unsigned int max_num = 0;
00047     if (increment) ++max_num;
00048     return max_num;
00049 }
00050 
00051 // This class can be used for storing pointers to the extension classes, used
00052 // in tlm_generic_payload:
00053 class tlm_extension_base
00054 {
00055 public:
00056     virtual tlm_extension_base* clone() const = 0;
00057     virtual void free() { delete this; }
00058     virtual void copy_from(tlm_extension_base const &) = 0;
00059 protected:
00060     virtual ~tlm_extension_base() {}
00061     static unsigned int register_extension()
00062     {
00063         return (max_num_extensions(true) - 1);
00064     };
00065 };
00066 
00067 // Base class for all extension classes, derive your extension class in
00068 // the following way:
00069 // class my_extension : public tlm_extension<my_extension> { ...
00070 // This triggers proper extension registration during C++ static
00071 // contruction time. my_extension::ID will hold the unique index in the
00072 // tlm_generic_payload::m_extensions array.
00073 template <typename T>
00074 class tlm_extension : public tlm_extension_base
00075 {
00076 public:
00077     virtual tlm_extension_base* clone() const = 0;
00078     virtual void copy_from(tlm_extension_base const &ext) = 0; //{assert(typeid(this)==typeid(ext)); assert(ID === ext.ID); assert(0);}
00079     virtual ~tlm_extension() {}
00080     const static unsigned int ID;
00081 };
00082 
00083 template <typename T>
00084 const
00085 unsigned int tlm_extension<T>::ID = tlm_extension_base::register_extension();
00086

00088 // enumeration types

00090 enum tlm_command {
00091     TLM_READ_COMMAND,
00092     TLM_WRITE_COMMAND,
00093     TLM_IGNORE_COMMAND
00094 };
00095 
00096 enum tlm_response_status {
00097     TLM_OK_RESPONSE = 1,
00098     TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESPONSE = 0,
00099     TLM_GENERIC_ERROR_RESPONSE = -1,
00100     TLM_ADDRESS_ERROR_RESPONSE = -2,
00101     TLM_COMMAND_ERROR_RESPONSE = -3,
00102     TLM_BURST_ERROR_RESPONSE = -4,
00103     TLM_BYTE_ENABLE_ERROR_RESPONSE = -5
00104 };

00106 #define TLM_BYTE_DISABLED 0x0
00107 #define TLM_BYTE_ENABLED 0xff

00109 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00110 // The generic payload class:
00111 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00112 class tlm_generic_payload {
00113 
00114 public:
00115     //---------------
00116     // Constructors
00117     //---------------
00118 
00119     // Default constructor
00120     tlm_generic_payload()
00121         : m_address(0)
00122         , m_command(TLM_IGNORE_COMMAND)
00123         , m_data(0)
00124         , m_length(0)
00125         , m_response_status(TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESPONSE)
00126         , m_dmi(false)
00127         , m_byte_enable(0)
00128         , m_byte_enable_length(0)
00129         , m_streaming_width(0)
00130         , m_extensions(max_num_extensions())
00131         , m_mm(0)
00132         , m_ref_count(0)
00133     {
00134     }
00135 
00136     explicit tlm_generic_payload(tlm_mm_interface* mm)
00137         : m_address(0)
00138         , m_command(TLM_IGNORE_COMMAND)
00139         , m_data(0)
00140         , m_length(0)
00141         , m_response_status(TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESPONSE)
00142         , m_dmi(false)
00143         , m_byte_enable(0)
00144         , m_byte_enable_length(0)
00145         , m_streaming_width(0)
00146         , m_extensions(max_num_extensions())
00147         , m_mm(mm)
00148         , m_ref_count(0)
00149     {
00150     }
00151 
00152     void acquire(){assert(m_mm != 0); m_ref_count++;}
00153     void release(){assert(m_mm != 0); if (--m_ref_count==0) m_mm->free(this);}
00154     int get_ref_count() const {return m_ref_count;}
00155     void set_mm(tlm_mm_interface* mm) { m_mm = mm; }
00156     bool has_mm() const { return m_mm != 0; }
00157 
00158     void reset(){
00159       //should the other members be reset too?
00160       m_extensions.free_entire_cache();
00161     };
00162 
00163 
00164 private:
00165     //disabled copy ctor and assignment operator.
00166     // Copy constructor
00167     tlm_generic_payload(const tlm_generic_payload& x)
00168         : m_address(x.get_address())
00169         , m_command(x.get_command())
00170         , m_data(x.get_data_ptr())
00171         , m_length(x.get_data_length())
00172         , m_response_status(x.get_response_status())
00173         , m_dmi(x.is_dmi_allowed())
00174         , m_byte_enable(x.get_byte_enable_ptr())
00175         , m_byte_enable_length(x.get_byte_enable_length())
00176         , m_streaming_width(x.get_streaming_width())
00177         , m_extensions(max_num_extensions())
00178     {
00179         // copy all extensions
00180         for(unsigned int i=0; i<m_extensions.size(); i++)
00181         {
00182             m_extensions[i] = x.get_extension(i);
00183         }
00184     }
00185 
00186     // Assignment operator
00187     tlm_generic_payload& operator= (const tlm_generic_payload& x)
00188     {
00189         m_command =            x.get_command();
00190         m_address =            x.get_address();
00191         m_data =               x.get_data_ptr();
00192         m_length =             x.get_data_length();
00193         m_response_status =    x.get_response_status();
00194         m_byte_enable =        x.get_byte_enable_ptr();
00195         m_byte_enable_length = x.get_byte_enable_length();
00196         m_streaming_width =    x.get_streaming_width();
00197         m_dmi =                x.is_dmi_allowed();
00198 
00199         // extension copy: all extension arrays must be of equal size by
00200         // construction (i.e. it must either be constructed after C++
00201         // static construction time, or the resize_extensions() method must
00202         // have been called prior to using the object)
00203         for(unsigned int i=0; i<m_extensions.size(); i++)
00204         {
00205             m_extensions[i] = x.get_extension(i);
00206         }
00207         return (*this);
00208     }
00209 public:
00210     // non-virtual deep-copying of the object
00211     void deep_copy_from(const tlm_generic_payload & other)
00212     {
00213         m_command =            other.get_command();
00214         m_address =            other.get_address();
00215         m_length =             other.get_data_length();
00216         m_response_status =    other.get_response_status();
00217         m_byte_enable_length = other.get_byte_enable_length();
00218         m_streaming_width =    other.get_streaming_width();
00219         m_dmi =                other.is_dmi_allowed();
00220 
00221         // deep copy data
00222         // there must be enough space in the target transaction!
00223         if(m_data && other.m_data)
00224         {
00225             memcpy(m_data, other.m_data, m_length);
00226         }
00227         // deep copy byte enables
00228         // there must be enough space in the target transaction!
00229         if(m_byte_enable && other.m_byte_enable)
00230         {
00231             memcpy(m_byte_enable, other.m_byte_enable, m_byte_enable_length);
00232         }
00233         // deep copy extensions (sticky and non-sticky)
00234         for(unsigned int i=0; i<other.m_extensions.size(); i++)
00235         {
00236             if(other.m_extensions[i])
00237             {                       //original has extension i
00238                 if(!m_extensions[i])
00239                 {                   //We don't: clone.
00240                     tlm_extension_base *ext = other.m_extensions[i]->clone();
00241                     if(ext)     //extension may not be clonable.
00242                     {
00243                         if(has_mm())
00244                         {           //mm can take care of removing cloned extensions
00245                             set_auto_extension(i, ext);
00246                         }
00247                         else
00248                         {           // no mm, user will call free_all_extensions().
00249                             set_extension(i, ext);
00250                         }
00251                     }
00252                 }
00253                 else
00254                 {                   //We already have such extension. Copy original over it.
00255                     m_extensions[i]->copy_from(*other.m_extensions[i]);
00256                 }
00257             }
00258         }
00259     }
00260 
00261     // To update the state of the original generic payload from a deep copy
00262     // Assumes that "other" was created from the original by calling deep_copy_from
00263     // Argument use_byte_enable_on_read determines whether to use or ignores byte enables
00264     // when copying back the data array on a read command
00265 
00266     void update_original_from(const tlm_generic_payload & other,
00267                               bool use_byte_enable_on_read = true)
00268     {
00269         // Copy back extensions that are present on the original
00270         update_extensions_from(other);
00271 
00272         // Copy back the response status and DMI hint attributes
00273         m_response_status = other.get_response_status();
00274         m_dmi             = other.is_dmi_allowed();
00275 
00276         // Copy back the data array for a read command only
00277         // deep_copy_from allowed null pointers, and so will we
00278         // We assume the arrays are the same size
00279         // We test for equal pointers in case the original and the copy share the same array
00280 
00281         if(is_read() && m_data && other.m_data && m_data != other.m_data)
00282         {
00283             if (m_byte_enable && use_byte_enable_on_read)
00284             {
00285                 if (m_byte_enable_length == 8 && m_length % 8 == 0 )
00286                 {
00287                     // Optimized implementation copies 64-bit words by masking
00288                     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_length; i += 8)
00289                     {
00290                         typedef sc_dt::uint64* u;
00291                         *reinterpret_cast<u>(&m_data[i]) &= ~*reinterpret_cast<u>(m_byte_enable);
00292                         *reinterpret_cast<u>(&m_data[i]) |= *reinterpret_cast<u>(&other.m_data[i]) &
00293                                                             *reinterpret_cast<u>(m_byte_enable);
00294                     }
00295                 }
00296                 else if (m_byte_enable_length == 4 && m_length % 4 == 0 )
00297                 {
00298                     // Optimized implementation copies 32-bit words by masking
00299                     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_length; i += 4)
00300                     {
00301                         typedef unsigned int* u;
00302                         *reinterpret_cast<u>(&m_data[i]) &= ~*reinterpret_cast<u>(m_byte_enable);
00303                         *reinterpret_cast<u>(&m_data[i]) |= *reinterpret_cast<u>(&other.m_data[i]) &
00304                                                             *reinterpret_cast<u>(m_byte_enable);
00305                     }
00306                 }
00307                 else
00308                     // Unoptimized implementation
00309                     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_length; i++)
00310                         if ( m_byte_enable[i % m_byte_enable_length] )
00311                             m_data[i] = other.m_data[i];
00312             }
00313             else
00314               memcpy(m_data, other.m_data, m_length);
00315         }
00316     }
00317 
00318     void update_extensions_from(const tlm_generic_payload & other)
00319     {
00320         // deep copy extensions that are already present
00321         for(unsigned int i=0; i<other.m_extensions.size(); i++)
00322         {
00323             if(other.m_extensions[i])
00324             {                       //original has extension i
00325                 if(m_extensions[i])
00326                 {                   //We have it too. copy.
00327                     m_extensions[i]->copy_from(*other.m_extensions[i]);
00328                 }
00329             }
00330         }
00331     }
00332 
00333     // Free all extensions. Useful when reusing a cloned transaction that doesn't have memory manager.
00334     // normal and sticky extensions are freed and extension array cleared.
00335     void free_all_extensions()
00336     {
00337         m_extensions.free_entire_cache();
00338         for(unsigned int i=0; i<m_extensions.size(); i++)
00339         {
00340             if(m_extensions[i])
00341             {
00342                 m_extensions[i]->free();
00343                 m_extensions[i] = 0;
00344             }
00345         }
00346     }
00347     //--------------
00348     // Destructor
00349     //--------------
00350     virtual ~tlm_generic_payload() {
00351         for(unsigned int i=0; i<m_extensions.size(); i++)
00352             if(m_extensions[i]) m_extensions[i]->free();
00353     }
00354

00365     void                 set_command(const tlm_command command) {m_command = command;}

00378 
00379     // Response status related methods
00380     bool                 is_response_ok() const {return (m_response_status > 0);}
00381     bool                 is_response_error() const {return (m_response_status <= 0);}
00382     tlm_response_status  get_response_status() const {return m_response_status;}
00383     void                 set_response_status(const tlm_response_status response_status)
00384         {m_response_status = response_status;}
00385     std::string          get_response_string() const
00386     {
00387         switch(m_response_status)
00388         {
00389         case TLM_OK_RESPONSE:            return "TLM_OK_RESPONSE";
00390         case TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESPONSE:    return "TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESPONSE";
00391         case TLM_GENERIC_ERROR_RESPONSE: return "TLM_GENERIC_ERROR_RESPONSE";
00392         case TLM_ADDRESS_ERROR_RESPONSE: return "TLM_ADDRESS_ERROR_RESPONSE";
00393         case TLM_COMMAND_ERROR_RESPONSE: return "TLM_COMMAND_ERROR_RESPONSE";
00394         case TLM_BURST_ERROR_RESPONSE:   return "TLM_BURST_ERROR_RESPONSE";
00395         case TLM_BYTE_ENABLE_ERROR_RESPONSE: return "TLM_BYTE_ENABLE_ERROR_RESPONSE";
00396         }
00397         return "TLM_UNKNOWN_RESPONSE";
00398     }

00411     // wants to indicate that a DMI request would be supported:
00412     void                 set_dmi_allowed(bool dmi_allowed) { m_dmi = dmi_allowed; }

00415 private:
00416 
00417     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00418     /* Generic Payload attributes:                                           */
00419     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00420     /* - m_command         : Type of transaction. Three values supported:    */
00421     /*                       - TLM_WRITE_COMMAND                             */
00422     /*                       - TLM_READ_COMMAND                              */
00423     /*                       - TLM_IGNORE_COMMAND                            */
00424     /* - m_address         : Transaction base address (byte-addressing).     */
00425     /* - m_data            : When m_command = TLM_WRITE_COMMAND contains a   */
00426     /*                       pointer to the data to be written in the target.*/
00427     /*                       When m_command = TLM_READ_COMMAND contains a    */
00428     /*                       pointer where to copy the data read from the    */
00429     /*                       target.                                         */
00430     /* - m_length          : Total number of bytes of the transaction.       */
00431     /* - m_response_status : This attribute indicates whether an error has   */
00432     /*                       occurred during the transaction.                */
00433     /*                       Values supported are:                           */
00434     /*                       - TLM_OK_RESP                                   */
00435     /*                       - TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESP                           */
00436     /*                       - TLM_GENERIC_ERROR_RESP                        */
00437     /*                       - TLM_ADDRESS_ERROR_RESP                        */
00438     /*                       - TLM_COMMAND_ERROR_RESP                        */
00439     /*                       - TLM_BURST_ERROR_RESP                          */
00440     /*                       - TLM_BYTE_ENABLE_ERROR_RESP                    */
00441     /*                                                                       */
00442     /* - m_byte_enable     : It can be used to create burst transfers where  */
00443     /*                    the address increment between each beat is greater */
00444     /*                    than the word length of each beat, or to place     */
00445     /*                    words in selected byte lanes of a bus.             */
00446     /* - m_byte_enable_length : For a read or a write command, the target    */
00447     /*                    interpret the byte enable length attribute as the  */
00448     /*                    number of elements in the bytes enable array.      */
00449     /* - m_streaming_width  :                                                */
00450     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00451 
00452     sc_dt::uint64        m_address;
00453     tlm_command          m_command;
00454     unsigned char*       m_data;
00455     unsigned int         m_length;
00456     tlm_response_status  m_response_status;
00457     bool                 m_dmi;
00458     unsigned char*       m_byte_enable;
00459     unsigned int         m_byte_enable_length;
00460     unsigned int         m_streaming_width;
00461 
00462 public:
00463 
00464     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00465     /* Dynamic extension mechanism:                                          */
00466     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00467     /* The extension mechanism is intended to enable initiator modules to    */
00468     /* optionally and transparently add data fields to the                   */
00469     /* tlm_generic_payload. Target modules are free to check for extensions  */
00470     /* and may or may not react to the data in the extension fields. The     */
00471     /* definition of the extensions' semantics is solely in the              */
00472     /* responsibility of the user.                                           */
00473     /*                                                                       */
00474     /* The following rules apply:                                            */
00475     /*                                                                       */
00476     /* - Every extension class must be derived from tlm_extension, e.g.:     */
00477     /*     class my_extension : public tlm_extension<my_extension> { ... }   */
00478     /*                                                                       */
00479     /* - A tlm_generic_payload object should be constructed after C++        */
00480     /*   static initialization time. This way it is guaranteed that the      */
00481     /*   extension array is of sufficient size to hold all possible          */
00482     /*   extensions. Alternatively, the initiator module can enforce a valid */
00483     /*   extension array size by calling the resize_extensions() method      */
00484     /*   once before the first transaction with the payload object is        */
00485     /*   initiated.                                                          */
00486     /*                                                                       */
00487     /* - Initiators should use the the set_extension(e) or clear_extension(e)*/
00488     /*   methods for manipulating the extension array. The type of the       */
00489     /*   argument must be a pointer to the specific registered extension     */
00490     /*   type (my_extension in the above example) and is used to             */
00491     /*   automatically locate the appropriate index in the array.            */
00492     /*                                                                       */
00493     /* - Targets can check for a specific extension by calling               */
00494     /*   get_extension(e). e will point to zero if the extension is not      */
00495     /*   present.                                                            */
00496     /*                                                                       */
00497     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00498 
00499     // Stick the pointer to an extension into the vector, return the
00500     // previous value:
00501     template <typename T> T* set_extension(T* ext)
00502     {
00503         return static_cast<T*>(set_extension(T::ID, ext));
00504     }
00505 
00506     // non-templatized version with manual index:
00507     tlm_extension_base* set_extension(unsigned int index,
00508                                       tlm_extension_base* ext)
00509     {
00510         tlm_extension_base* tmp = m_extensions[index];
00511         m_extensions[index] = ext;
00512         return tmp;
00513     }
00514 
00515     // Stick the pointer to an extension into the vector, return the
00516     // previous value and schedule its release
00517     template <typename T> T* set_auto_extension(T* ext)
00518     {
00519         return static_cast<T*>(set_auto_extension(T::ID, ext));
00520     }
00521 
00522     // non-templatized version with manual index:
00523     tlm_extension_base* set_auto_extension(unsigned int index,
00524                                            tlm_extension_base* ext)
00525     {
00526         tlm_extension_base* tmp = m_extensions[index];
00527         m_extensions[index] = ext;
00528         if (!tmp) m_extensions.insert_in_cache(&m_extensions[index]);
00529         assert(m_mm != 0);
00530         return tmp;
00531     }
00532 
00533     // Check for an extension, ext will point to 0 if not present
00534     template <typename T> void get_extension(T*& ext) const
00535     {
00536         ext = get_extension<T>();
00537     }
00538     template <typename T> T* get_extension() const
00539     {
00540         return static_cast<T*>(get_extension(T::ID));
00541     }
00542     // Non-templatized version with manual index:
00543     tlm_extension_base* get_extension(unsigned int index) const
00544     {
00545         return m_extensions[index];
00546     }
00547 
00548     //this call just removes the extension from the txn but does not
00549     // call free() or tells the MM to do so
00550     // it return false if there was active MM so you are now in an unsafe situation
00551     // recommended use: when 100% sure there is no MM
00552     template <typename T> void clear_extension(const T* ext)
00553     {
00554         clear_extension<T>();
00555     }
00556 
00557     //this call just removes the extension from the txn but does not
00558     // call free() or tells the MM to do so
00559     // it return false if there was active MM so you are now in an unsafe situation
00560     // recommended use: when 100% sure there is no MM
00561     template <typename T> void clear_extension()
00562     {
00563         clear_extension(T::ID);
00564     }
00565 
00566     //this call removes the extension from the txn and does
00567     // call free() or tells the MM to do so when the txn is finally done
00568     // recommended use: when not sure there is no MM
00569     template <typename T> void release_extension(T* ext)
00570     {
00571         release_extension<T>();
00572     }
00573 
00574     //this call removes the extension from the txn and does
00575     // call free() or tells the MM to do so when the txn is finally done
00576     // recommended use: when not sure there is no MM
00577     template <typename T> void release_extension()
00578     {
00579         release_extension(T::ID);
00580     }
00581 
00582 private:
00583     // Non-templatized version with manual index
00584     void clear_extension(unsigned int index)
00585     {
00586         m_extensions[index] = static_cast<tlm_extension_base*>(0);
00587     }
00588     // Non-templatized version with manual index
00589     void release_extension(unsigned int index)
00590     {
00591         if (m_mm)
00592         {
00593             m_extensions.insert_in_cache(&m_extensions[index]);
00594         }
00595         else
00596         {
00597             m_extensions[index]->free();
00598             m_extensions[index] = static_cast<tlm_extension_base*>(0);
00599         }
00600     }
00601 
00602 public:
00603     // Make sure the extension array is large enough. Can be called once by
00604     // an initiator module (before issuing the first transaction) to make
00605     // sure that the extension array is of correct size. This is only needed
00606     // if the initiator cannot guarantee that the generic payload object is
00607     // allocated after C++ static construction time.
00608     void resize_extensions()
00609     {
00610         m_extensions.expand(max_num_extensions());
00611     }
00612 
00613 private:
00614     tlm_array<tlm_extension_base*> m_extensions;
00615     tlm_mm_interface*              m_mm;
00616     unsigned int                   m_ref_count;
00617 };
00618 
00619 } // namespace tlm
00620 
00621 #endif /* __TLM_GP_H__ */
